image.altText: Police tape on a suburban Adelaide street.

props.synopsis: The boy was last seen at his family homestead at about 5pm on Saturday.

title.children: Police searching for four-year-old boy missing in remote SA

image.altText: A dark-coloured feral pig on some grass near a patch of mud.

props.synopsis: Dozens of pigs were released illegally over several attempts to establish populations for hunting, with a local landscape board warning of the danger a feral population could cause.

title.children: Feral pigs found in SA were imported illegally from NSW, testing shows

image.altText: An image of two men composited next to each other. They both wear suits. One has short dark hair, the other has grey.

props.synopsis: South Australia's algal bloom continues to cause political headaches for state and federal Labor. Perhaps that's why scientists are copping some of the flak now.

title.children: As algal bloom recriminations grow, politicians point to the scientists

image.altText: A woman with short, curly grey hair stands next to a box planter pouring water from a green watering can.

props.synopsis: Dead sea life washed ashore during SA's marine algal bloom has been diverted into commercial compost for farms and gardens, in what has been viewed as a small win amid the large-scale devastation.

title.children: Algal bloom sea casualties find new life in commercial compost

image.altText: A man with blond hair and a blue sweat band standing in front of the sea link ferry.

props.synopsis: Nicholas Tremaine is cycling more than 40,000 kilometres to raise $1 million to fight the condition that's befallen his mother and is now Australia's leading cause of death.

title.children: Cyclist's gruelling fundraising mission to raise dementia awareness

image.altText: A young Indigenous teen girl points with a pointer in a classroom

props.synopsis: Jaz Fusi has been passionate about learning Paakantyi language for most of her life. Now, she teaches it to her local school's teachers and is eager to see other kids do the same.

title.children: Teenage student becomes Indigenous language teacher at outback NSW school

image.altText: Steam engine crossing a railway bridge.

props.synopsis: Forget about being crammed on a suburban train, the real romance of rail is found through luxury long-distance inland trips or journeys back in time.

title.children: Australia's top rail journeys for tourists wanting to take it all in

image.altText: A mans hand holds a curved knife, it has a blue pointed blade and knuckle shaped handle, with a hold for thumb in it

props.synopsis: SA Police has announced Declared Public Precincts at eight shopping centres in metropolitan Adelaide, with a knife discovered in the first 15 minutes of a patrol at Marion Shopping Centre.

title.children: Knife found on first day of expanded police powers at shopping centres in Adelaide

image.altText: A dead shark lies on the sand of a beach

props.synopsis: Investigations into nine white shark deaths this year have revealed at least three are likely to have been killed by the toxic algal bloom. Warning: This story contains images that some readers may find distressing.

title.children: At least three shark deaths linked to algal bloom, report shows

image.altText: Man standing with hand on hip at the front of the Adelaide Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: A well-known Adelaide tailor has been issued a fine by the Adelaide Magistrates Court for smoking outside his CBD business to cope with stress.

title.children: Tailor fined for smoking outside Adelaide CBD business

image.altText: A head-shot of a man in a suit, looking serious.

props.synopsis: Health Minister Mark Butler admits black market tobacco is now the single biggest threat to public health.

title.children: Health minister concedes tobacco black market has 'exploded'

image.altText: A man in a suit stands behind a lectern with media microphones on it. To his left is a woman holding a piece of paper

props.synopsis: South Australia's Premier says the government is grappling with whether it should give daily updates on the bloom's location during summer, and says it has been "actively engaged" in conversations with the federal government since its emergence.

title.children: SA government grapples with whether it should issue daily bloom updates during summer

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas is wearing a blue suit with a white button up shirt with cameras pointing at him

props.synopsis: The debate over Santos's Narrabri gas project reignites, with traditional owners condemning 'disgraceful' comments made by two state premiers.

title.children: Traditional owners slam SA premier for 'disgraceful' call on Santos gas project

image.altText: A rabbit.

props.synopsis: A teacher and a librarian banned from working with children after they were charged with ill-treating animals have lost a bid to have the ban rescinded.

title.children: Teacher and librarian accused of animal cruelty lose bid to continue working with kids

image.altText: A large body of blue water within a reservior

props.synopsis: SA Water — which is owned by the SA government — has been fined for polluting the waterways with grey clay silt when draining the Warren Reservoir, in the Barossa Valley, in May 2023.

title.children: SA Water fined $60k for botched reservoir maintenance that sent sludge into waterways

image.altText: A man holds a red lobster towards the camera.

props.synopsis: After years of export trade disruptions, southern Australian rock lobster commercial fishers are hauling in catches that will fetch up to $125 per kilogram.

title.children: China's appetite for Aussie lobster pushes prices to five-year high

image.altText: A man with black dreadlocks wearing a white basketball jersey and shorts dribbles a basketball down a court

props.synopsis: The Adelaide 36ers terminate Montrezl Harrell's contract while he serves a provisional ban after testing positive for an illicit substance.

title.children: Montrezl Harrell dropped by 36ers while doping ban continues

image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding up a phone, with an incoming call from a mysterious hooded figure.

props.synopsis: Individuals who contact a survivor of abuse or personal injury without their permission to encourage them to make a claim for compensation could face fines of up to $50,000 under new laws which have passed in South Australia.

title.children: 'Claim farmers' face fines of up to $50,000 under new SA laws

image.altText: Two men, one in a blue polo shirt and cap and the other in a maroon top, hold up a silver trophy cup on a stage.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Brisbane and Geelong fans have lined the streets around the MCG ahead of the 2025 AFL Grand Final.

title.children: Passion and nerves hit fever pitch at AFL Grand Final parade

image.altText: A large truck carrying neatly piled wood logs enters a large yard with thousands of large wooden logs.

props.synopsis: With biofuels earmarked as a way to power the transport sector in the future, one industry says its waste can be converted into aviation and shipping fuel.

title.children: Ambitious plan to convert forestry waste into fuel for ships and planes

image.altText: An older couple with their heads close together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. It has been a long wait for the family ahead of the release of coronial findings into his death next month.

title.children: Family's anger at seven-year coronial inquest wait

image.altText: An SA police vehicle

props.synopsis: South Australia Police says a Vale Park man has been charged following a pursuit that led STAR group officers and police negotiators to a unit in Adelaide's western suburbs.

title.children: Man to face court over incident involving STAR officers

image.altText: A building with grey, green and brown colouring and the words 'Edge Early Learning'

props.synopsis: A childcare centre in Adelaide's inner south-west has been ordered to close for two weeks after being handed an emergency action notice following claims children were left unsupervised.

title.children: Childcare centre temporarily shut amid claims children were left unsupervised

image.altText: Instagram posts float around head of person in beanie and hoodie in dark room, their face is lit by small slither of light

props.synopsis: Gender stereotypes "play a role" in allowing predators like Kellie Whiteside to fly under the radar, but that's not the whole story.

title.children: 'A predator is not a male or a female': How a community missed the signs of grooming

image.altText: Mohammad Shareed Hotak - man with dark hair in green shirt

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission has ordered Uber to repay lost wages to a driver it deemed was unfairly deactivated from the rideshare platform.

title.children: Uber ordered to pay lost wages in 'landmark' unfair deactivation case

image.altText: Bright yellow canola flowers in a paddock fill the frame.

props.synopsis: Selfie hunters seeking the perfect social media photo among flowering canola are putting their safety and growers' livelihoods at risk, farmers say.

title.children: Farmers notice more canola crop trespassers wandering into paddocks

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield and Lachie Neale smile while holding the premiership cup and standing in front of a crowd of fans

props.synopsis: When they meet at the MCG on Saturday afternoon, Geelong and Brisbane are bidding for more than just the 2025 premiership. For the two most dominant clubs of a generation, true greatness is at hand.

title.children: The AFL's 21st-century titans meet in a grand final 25 years in the making

image.altText: A close up of Andrew Hastie against a blue curtain.

props.synopsis: The West Australian veteran has a clear vision for the future of the Liberal Party — and he's making it known.

title.children: Andrew Hastie wants to be Liberal leader. The question is when

image.altText: A large blue machine squirts concrete out a nozzle onto a concrete wall while a tradie in high-viz stands next to it.

props.synopsis: A new 3D-printed home build in Victoria's west is due to be completed in October, with the construction team hoping the technology could be another solution to the housing crisis.

title.children: Builder of 3D-printed home says tech on the cusp of being the norm

image.altText: Jeffrey Epstein in a bright yellow jacket stands grinning in front of a small black plane

props.synopsis: The documents include flight logs, massage messages and cash transactions in Jeffrey Epstein's ledger.

title.children: Newly released Epstein files name Prince Andrew, Elon Musk, Bill Gates

image.altText: a man with sunglasses sits in a large chair

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation reveals Tylere Baker-Pearce, a former political candidate who has posted a selfie smiling outside Auschwitz, was the man charged with performing a Nazi salute at an AFL game.

title.children: Identity revealed of man charged with Nazi salute at AFL game

image.altText: A smiling young man with a neck tattoo.

props.synopsis: Caleb Pokai says he was banned from entering the Burleigh Pavilion while out dinner with friends due to his tā moko.

title.children: Māori man refused entry to Gold Coast venue due to cultural tattoo

image.altText: An aerial image of a housing development with a green arrow pointing downwards next to a percentage sign

props.synopsis: Cutting the cash rate results in cheaper mortgage repayments for most people paying off a home loan — but economists aren't generally expecting that to happen this month.

title.children: Why we aren't expecting a rate cut at the next RBA meeting

image.altText: Jahrome Hughes breaks through a Will Kennedy tackle.

props.synopsis: Jahrome Hughes leads Melbourne back into the NRL grand final, scoring a try in a 22-14 win over the Cronulla Sharks just 22 days after breaking his arm.

title.children: Hughes defies broken arm to spark Storm into another grand final
